code.value:
from typing import Optional
from genflow import CustomComponent
from langchain.schema import Document
from genflow.utils.util import build_loader_repr_from_documents


class RecursiveCharacterTextSplitterComponent(CustomComponent):
    display_name: str = "Recursive Character Text Splitter"
    description: str = "Split text into chunks of a specified length."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.aiplanet.com/components/text-splitters#recursivecharactertextsplitter"
    
    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "documents": {
                "display_name": "Documents",
                "info": "The documents to split.",
            },
            "separators": {
                "display_name": "Separators",
                "info": 'The characters to split on.\nIf left empty defaults to ["\\n\\n", "\\n", " ", ""].',
                "is_list": True,
            },
            "chunk_size": {
                "display_name": "Chunk Size",
                "info": "The maximum length of each chunk.",
                "field_type": "int",
                "value": 1000,
            },
            "chunk_overlap": {
                "display_name": "Chunk Overlap",
                "info": "The amount of overlap between chunks.",
                "field_type": "int",
                "value": 200,
            },
            "code": {"show": False},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        documents: list[Document],
        separators: Optional[list[str]] = None,
        chunk_size: Optional[int] = 1000,
        chunk_overlap: Optional[int] = 200,
    ) -> list[Document]:
        """
        Split text into chunks of a specified length.

        Args:
            separators (list[str]): The characters to split on.
            chunk_size (int): The maximum length of each chunk.
            chunk_overlap (int): The amount of overlap between chunks.
            length_function (function): The function to use to calculate the length of the text.

        Returns:
            list[str]: The chunks of text.
        """
        from langchain.text_splitter import RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter

        if separators == "":
            separators = None
        elif separators:
            # check if the separators list has escaped characters
            # if there are escaped characters, unescape them
            separators = [x.encode().decode("unicode-escape") for x in separators]

        # Make sure chunk_size and chunk_overlap are ints
        if isinstance(chunk_size, str):
            chunk_size = int(chunk_size)
        if isinstance(chunk_overlap, str):
            chunk_overlap = int(chunk_overlap)
        splitter = RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter(
            separators=separators,
            chunk_size=chunk_size,
            chunk_overlap=chunk_overlap,
        )

        docs = splitter.split_documents(documents)
        self.repr_value = build_loader_repr_from_documents(docs)
        return docs
code.name: code

chunk_overlap.name: chunk_overlap
chunk_overlap.info: The amount of overlap between chunks.

chunk_size.name: chunk_size
chunk_size.info: The maximum length of each chunk.

separators.name: separators
separators.info:
The characters to split on.
If left empty defaults to ["

", "
", " ", ""].

node.description: Split text into chunks of a specified length.

from typing import Optional
from genflow.interface.custom import CustomComponent
from langchain.llms.base import BaseLLM
from langchain.chat_models import AzureChatOpenAI


class AzureChatOpenAILLM(CustomComponent):
    display_name: str = "AzureChatOpenAI"
    description: str = "Azure Chat Open AI Chat&Completion large language models."
    documentation: str = "https://docs.aiplanet.com/components/large-language-models#azurechatopenai"
    
    AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS = [
        "gpt-4",
        "gpt-4-32k",
        "gpt-4-vision",
    ]

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "model": {
                "display_name": "Model Name",
                "value": "gpt-4",
                "options": self.AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS,
                "required": True,
            },
            "api_key": {
                "display_name": "AzureChatOpenAI API Key",
                "required": True,
                "password": True,
            },
            "api_base": {
                "display_name": "AzureChatOpenAI API Base",
                "required": True,
            },
            "api_type": {"display_name": "AzureChatOpenAI API Type", "required": True},
            "azure_deployment": {
                "display_name": "Deployment Name",
                "required": True,
            },
            "api_version": {
                "display_name": "API Version",
                "value": "2023-07-01-preview",
                "required": True,
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "temperature": {
                "display_name": "Temperature",
                "value": 0.5,
                "field_type": "float",
                "required": False,
            },
            "max_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Max Tokens",
                "value": 512,
                "required": False,
                "field_type": "int",
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "code": {"show": False},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        model: str,
        api_base: str,
        api_type: str,
        api_key: str,
        azure_deployment: str,
        api_version: str = "2023-05-15",
        temperature: Optional[float] = 0.7,
        max_tokens: Optional[int] = 512,
    ) -> BaseLLM:
        try:
            output = AzureChatOpenAI(
                model_name=model,
                openai_api_base=api_base,
                openai_api_type=api_type,
                openai_api_key=api_key,
                openai_api_version=api_version,
                deployment_name=azure_deployment,
                temperature=temperature,
                max_tokens=max_tokens,
            )
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not connect to Azure ChatOpenAI model.") from e
        return output
code.name: code

node.description: Azure Chat Open AI Chat&Completion large language models.

code.value:
from genflow import CustomComponent
from typing import Optional, List, Dict, Union
from openai import OpenAI
from langchain.schema import Document
from langchain.docstore.document import Document

class Component(CustomComponent):
    display_name: str = "Whisper Transcriber"
    description: str = "Converts audio to text using OpenAI's Whisper."

    def build_config(self):
        return {"audio":
            {"field_type":"file",
            "suffixes":[".mp3", ".mp4"],"input_types":["Input"]},
            "OpenAIKey":
                {"field_type":"str","password":True,"input_types":["Input"]}
        }

    def build(self, audio:str, OpenAIKey:str) -> List[Document]:
        client = OpenAI(api_key=OpenAIKey)
        
        audio_file= open(audio, "rb")
        transcript = client.audio.transcriptions.create(
          model="whisper-1", 
          file=audio_file,
          response_format="text"
        )
        
        self.status = transcript
        doc =  Document(page_content=transcript, metadata={"source": "audio"})
        return doc
code.name: code

node.description: Converts audio to text using OpenAI's Whisper.
Input is used to specify the type of input.

code.name: code

input_key.name: input_key
input_key.info: The variable to be used as Chat Input when more than one variable is available.

output_key.name: output_key
output_key.info: The variable to be used as Chat Output (e.g. answer in a ConversationalRetrievalChain)

code.value:
from typing import Optional
from genflow import CustomComponent

from langchain.vectorstores.weaviate import Weaviate
from langchain.schema import Document
from langchain.vectorstores.base import VectorStore
from langchain.embeddings.base import Embeddings
import weaviate


class WeaviateComponent(CustomComponent):
    """
    A custom component for implementing a Vector Store using Weaviate.
    """

    display_name: str = "Weaviate"
    description: str = "Implementation of Vector Store using Weaviate"
    documentation = "https://docs.aiplanet.com/components/vector-store#weaviate"
    beta: bool = True
    version: str = "1.1"

    def build_config(self):
        """
        Builds the configuration for the component.

        Returns:
        - dict: A dictionary containing the configuration options for the component.
        """
        return {
            "code": {"show": False, "display_name": "Code"},
            "url": {
                "display_name": "Weaviate URL",
                "advanced": True,
                "required": True,
            },
            "api_key": {
                "display_name": "API Key",
                "required": True,
                "advanced": True,
                "password": True,
            },
            "index_name": {
                "display_name": "Index Name",
                "value": "genflow",
                "required": False,
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "text_key": {
                "display_name": "Text Key",
                "value": "text",
                "required": False,
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "embedding": {"display_name": "Embedding"},
            "documents": {"display_name": "Documents", "is_list": True},
            "search_by_text": {
                "display_name": "Search By Text",
                "value": False,
                "required": False,
                "advanced": True,
            },
        }

    def build(
        self,
        url: str,
        index_name: Optional[str] = "genflow",
        api_key: Optional[str] = None,
        text_key: str = "text",
        embedding: Optional[Embeddings] = None,
        documents: Optional[Document] = None,
        search_by_text: bool = False,
    ) -> VectorStore:
        """
        Builds the Vector Store or BaseRetriever object.

        Args:
        - url (str): The URL of the Weaviate instance.
        - index_name (str): The name of the index.
        - api_key (Optional[str]): The API key for Weaviate.
        - text_key (str): The key to use for text in Weaviate.
        - embedding (Optional[Embeddings]): The embeddings to use for the Vector Store.
        - documents (Optional[Document]): The documents to use for the Vector Store.
        - search_by_text (bool): Whether to search by text or by vector.

        Returns:
        - Union[VectorStore, BaseRetriever]: The Vector Store or BaseRetriever object.
        """

        if api_key:
            auth_config = weaviate.AuthApiKey(api_key=api_key)
            client = weaviate.Client(url=url, auth_client_secret=auth_config)
        else:
            client = weaviate.Client(url=url)

        if documents is not None and embedding is not None:
            for doc in documents:
                doc.metadata = {k: v for k, v in doc.metadata.items() if bool(k)}

            return Weaviate.from_documents(
                documents=documents,
                embedding=embedding,
                client=client,
                index_name=index_name,
                text_key=text_key,
            )

        if embedding is not None:
            return Weaviate(
                client=client,
                index_name=index_name,
                text_key=text_key,
                embedding=embedding,
                by_text=search_by_text,
            )

        return Weaviate(
            client=client,
            index_name=index_name,
            text_key=text_key,
            by_text=search_by_text,
        )
code.name: code

node.description: Implementation of Vector Store using Weaviate

code.value:
from typing import Optional, Union, Callable
from genflow import CustomComponent
from genflow.field_typing import (
    BasePromptTemplate,
    BaseLanguageModel,
    BaseMemory,
    Chain,
    BaseRetriever,
)
from langchain.chains import ConversationalRetrievalChain
from langchain.prompts import PromptTemplate


class ConversationalRetrievalChainComponent(CustomComponent):
    """
    A custom component for implementing a RetrievalQA using Prompt.
    """

    display_name: str = "ConversationalRetrievalChain"
    description: str = "Implementation of ConversationalRetrievalChain: allows Memory, Custom Prompt, Retriever"
    documentation: str = (
        "https://docs.aiplanet.com/components/chains#conversationalretrievalchain"
    )
    beta: bool = True
    version: str = "1.0"

    CHAIN_TYPE_OPTIONS = ["stuff", "map_reduce", "refine", "map_rerank"]

    def build_config(self):
        """
        Builds the configuration for the component.

        Returns:
        - dict: A dictionary containing the configuration options for the component.
        """
        return {
            "chain_type": {
                "display": "chain_type",
                "value": "stuff",
                "options": self.CHAIN_TYPE_OPTIONS,
                "required": True,
            },
            "llm": {"display_name": "LLM", "required": True},
            "prompt": {"display_name": "Prompt"},
            "memory": {"display_name": "Memory"},
            "retriever": {"display_name": "Retriever", "required": True},
            "code": {"show": False},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        llm: BaseLanguageModel,
        retriever: BaseRetriever,
        prompt: Optional[BasePromptTemplate] = None,
        chain_type: str = "stuff",
        memory: BaseMemory = None,
    ) -> Chain:
        """
        Builds the RetrievalQA with prompt

        Args:
        - llm: Large Language Models
        - chain_type: used to load a specific type of chain for question-answering
        - chain_type_kwargs: chain keywords argument to pass prompt
        - retriever: vector store to retrieve k relevant context information
        - memory: memory to provide chat_history for object

        Returns:
        - Chain: The ConversationalRetrievalChain.from_llm
        """

        DEFAULT_TEMPLATE = """
            Answer the question based on the chat history(delimited by <hs></hs>) and context(delimited by <ctx> </ctx>) below.
            -----------
            <ctx>
            {context}
            </ctx>
            -----------
            <hs>
            {chat_history}
            </hs>
            -----------
            Question: {question}
            Answer:
        """

        DEFAULT_PROMPT = PromptTemplate(
            input_variables=["context", "question", "chat_history"],
            template=DEFAULT_TEMPLATE,
        )

        if prompt == None:
            prompt = DEFAULT_PROMPT

        return ConversationalRetrievalChain.from_llm(
            llm=llm,
            retriever=retriever,
            chain_type=chain_type,
            return_source_documents=True,
            verbose=False,
            combine_docs_chain_kwargs={"prompt": prompt},
            memory=memory,
        )
code.name: code

node.description: Implementation of ConversationalRetrievalChain: allows Memory, Custom Prompt, Retriever

code.name: code
